content.description:
A traverse across the wall using the lowest slot for your feet. Start on the small concrete pedestal a few feet to the east of the lowest horizontal slot in the wall. Traverse across approximately 11 meters to the west using any slot for your hands, and the lowest slot for your feet. Finish when both feet are at the most western end of the slot.   



the start is the small concrete pedestal a few feet to the east of the lowest horizontal slot in the wall.


boulder problem, low traverse, low fall risk.

A south facing wall at the corner of 100Ave and 121st St NW. It is on the downward side of The Promenade (boulevard) park. 

The wall features 5 horizontal slots with approximately 25mm edges, a roof with a good under cling and knee-bar potential, and an upper lip at street level with some stone pillars that could be used as finishes to new routes.  

By default boulders listed on this wall do not include metal features, all railings, nails, or other metal features are out unless specifically stated otherwise.
